result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin S McFarland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Consecutive to: Rusk County Case 11CF63.

same conditions as probation.
Consecutive to: Rusk County case 11CF63

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

07/20/2020 AMENDED: COURT EXTENDS PROBATION FOR A PERIOD OF 6 MONTHS OR UNTIL COMPLETION OF 120 HOURS OF COMMUNITY SERVICE.
Consecutive to: Rusk County cases 11CM183 & 11CM182
05/09/2017 CORRECTED TO CHANGE 11CF183 TO 11CM183.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge. DNA specimen form given to Defendant in court.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

timeConds.notes: Court orders 15 days jail. The jail time may be served by 120 hours of community service work to be completed within one year following release from 6 month jail sentence.  If the defendant fails to perform the community service as ordered he/she must report to the jail as ordered with credit of 1 day of jail served for each 8 hours of community service completed.

1/17/2018 COURT ORDERS HUBER AND GOOD TIME PRIVILEGES REVOKED.
Court orders work release. May leave the jail to attend AODA and other recommended treatment by probation agent.
Court orders 15 days jail. The jail time may be served by 120 hours of community service work to be completed within 1 year after release from jail on 6 month sentence.   If the defendant fails to perform the community service as ordered he/she must report to the jail as ordered with credit of 1 day of jail served for each 8 hours of community service completed.

Court orders: Imposed & Stayed
 3 years, 6 months prison. - STAYED 
Initial confinement - 1 year, 6 months, Extended Supervision - 2 years, 0 months. Consecutive to Rusk County case 11CF63
Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration but is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

3 Years probation- IMPOSED 
Probation Conditions:  Consecutive to Rusk County cases 11CM183 & 11CM182, where jail has been ordered. 
6 months in jail with work release, may leave jail to attend AODA and all other recommended treatment by probation agent. 
When released from jail must meet with community service coordinator, 120 hours community service must be completed within one year after release.  If not completed, 15 days jail will be added. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.  
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment. 
Costs
